alert.note: Alert for Gentry; Harrison; Nodaway; Worth (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:31AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Worth, northern Gentry, northwestern Harrison and northeastern Nodaway Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 631 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Athelstan to near Grant City to near Ravenwood. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bethany, Albany, Grant City, Ravenwood, Eagleville, New Hampton, Irena, Athelstan, Conception Junction, Sheridan, Blythedale, Parnell, Clyde, Gentry, Worth, Allendale, Denver, Conception, Hatfield and Martinsville. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 95 and 114. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
